title: Lindsay Lohan Follows Kanye West's Lead, By Announcing She Wants To Run For President
text:
Lindsay Lohan Follows Kanye West's Lead, By Announcing She Wants To Run For President The Huffington Post UK | By Daniel Welsh 
Lindsay Lohan appears to have taken a leaf out of Kanye West ’s book… and no, we don’t mean that she’s starting a rap career (although that would be amazing). READ MORE: Lindsay Lohan To Sue Fox News For Defamation 
In fact, it would seem that the latest celebrity trend isn’t veganism, giving your children outlandish names or even a new mystical religion nobody else has heard of - it’s running for president. 
Yes, writing on her Instagram page on Friday night, Lindsay revealed that she could well run for the next president of the United States in 2020. 
O...K then. 
Lindsay Lohan, future president of the United States? 
She wrote: “In #2020 I may run for president. Through ups and downs #YESWECAN lets do this @kanyewest #truespirits 
“Thank you for inspiring us to be better people @barackobama #kanyewest2020 #lindsaylohan2020 with #34yearsofEXPERIENCE #unitingWORLDnations [sic]” A photo posted by Lindsay Lohan (@lindsaylohan) on Oct 16, 2015 at 5:23pm PDT 
The ‘Mean Girls’ actress then uploaded another picture, this time alluding to the time she’s spent living in London, and what that has taught her. 
Lindsay adds: “The first thing I would like to do as president of [America] is take care of all the children suffering in the world… #queenELIZABETH showed me how by having me in her country.” A photo posted by Lindsay Lohan (@lindsaylohan) on Oct 16, 2015 at 5:38pm PDT 
Kanye West shocked everyone back in August when, during an acceptance speech at this year’s MTV Video Music Awards, he blurted out that he was going to run for President in 2020 . 
The rapper was accepting his Michael Jackson Video Vanguard Award when he made a typically Kanye-esque speech, touching on everything from his very public beef with Taylor Swift, his disillusionment about awards shows in general and the negative perception of him in the media (as well as confessing to have “rolled a little something” before coming out on stage). 
Kanye West at the VMAs 
However, no one was compared for how he ended the 13-minute speech, when he announced: “It's not about me. It's about ideas. New ideas. People with ideas. People who believe in truth. And yes, as you probably could've guessed by this moment, I have decided in 2020 to run for president.” 
We can’t wait for the inevitable Lohan vs West political debates that are no doubt just around the corner... Close Lindsay Lohan: Her Biggest Successes So Far of   Lindsay took on not one but two roles (and accents!) in the 1998 Disney remake of 'The Parent Trap', for which she received critical acclaim. She was just 12 years old when it was released to cinemas. Her parts in 'Confessions Of A Teenage Drama Queen' and 'Freaky Friday' proved successful, but it was ultimately playing Cady Heron in the totally fetch 'Mean Girls' that would see Lindsay's profile skyrocket. We're not trying to suggest that Lindsay has one of the top voices of her generation or anything (at least not out loud) ... Because who doesn't love a good pair of leggings? Lindsay said, during an interview with Andy Cohen, that she was most proud of her performance in 'Georgia Rule' opposite Felicity Huffman and Jane Fonda, although it was during the making of this film that rumours began to spread that she was difficult to work with. Lindsay starred opposite porn star James Deen in the 2013 thriller, 'The Canyons'. Although the publicity for the film was largely overshadowed by Shortly after her most recent stint in rehab (which she joked was a 'court-ordered vacation), Lindsay showed up to guest host Chelsea Handler's talk show, 'Chelsea Lately'. What could have been an awkward experience actually turned out to be very funny indeed, largely due to the one-liners delivered by Lindsay, who poked fun at her fellow celebrities including Justin Bieber, Harry Styles and Kanye West. Days after getting out of rehab last year, Lindsay began filming her own reality series for Oprah Winfrey's OWN network. Although at times it made for difficult viewing, 'Lindsay' proved that the star was ready to get back to work, and wanted to become known for her acting again, rather than her turbulent personal life. Promoting her docuseries in the UK, Lindsay sat down for an interview with Alan Carr on his talk show, where she got the chance to show off her great sense of humour, often eclipsed by the tabloid furore that surrounds her, and even gave the comedian an impromptu pole dancing lesson. Saucy. Watch this space...
